citation.article-title: Natronobacterium gen. nov. and Natronococcus gen. nov., two new genera of haloalkaliphilic archaebacteria.

p.s: Description of Natronobacterium magadii sp.nov.
Natronobacterium magadii (ma.ga.d'ii. M.L. gen. n. of proper name Magadi; Lake Magadi, a saline soda lake in Kenya)
Cells rod-shaped, 0.7-0.9 by 2-4 μm in liquid media, spherical on solid medium (1-1.5 μm diameter).
Cells lyse in hypotonic solutions (<1.5M NaCl).
Colonies orange-red, 2-3 mm in diameter with wrinkled appearance.
Motile by polar flagella.
Chemoorganotroph.
Strict aerobe.
Optimum growth at 20% NaCl (3.5M).
Obligately alkaliphilic requiring sodium carbonate.
Optimum pH of 9.5 for growth.
Optimum temperature for growth 37-40 °C.
Carbohydrates are not utilised although acetate stimulates growth.
Sensitive to erythromycin.
Gelatin is liquefied, sulphide produced from thiosulphate.
Does not reduce nitrates or nitrites.
Does not hydrolyse starch.
G + C content of DNA is 63.0 mol % for the major component. possesses a minor DNA component with G + C content of 49.5 mol% (buoyant density).
Possesses a large plasmid of c 144 kb.
Type strain: MS3 deposited as Natronobacterium magadii in NCMB (Tindall, 1980: Ross et al., 1981) as NCMB 2190.
